Type.Name: Editable

TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Editable implements class GLib.IWrapper

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

MemberSignature.Value: public event EventHandler Changed;
.event class System.EventHandler Changed

Docs.summary: Raised when the user has changed the contents of the widget.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyClipboard ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyClipboard() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes the characters in the current selection to be copied to the clipboard.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CutClipboard ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CutClipboard() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes the characters in the current selection to be copied to the clipboard and then deleted from the widget.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteSelection ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DeleteSelection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes the characters in the current selection to be deleted.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteText (int start_pos, int end_pos);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DeleteText(int32 start_pos, int32 end_pos) cil managed

Docs.summary: Deletes a sequence of characters. The characters that are deleted are those characters at positions from up to, but not including . If is negative, then the the characters deleted will be those characters from to the end of the text.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetChars (int start_pos, int end_pos);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetChars(int32 start_pos, int32 end_pos) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves a sequence of characters. The characters that are retrieved are those characters at positions from up to, but not including . If is negative, then the the characters retrieved will be those characters from to the end of the text.
Docs.returns: The characters between and (but not including) .

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetSelectionBounds (out int start_pos, out int end_pos);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool GetSelectionBounds(int32 start_pos, int32 end_pos) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the current selection bounds, if there is a selection
Docs.returns: Boolean, TRUE if there is a selection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void InsertText (string new_text, ref int position);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void InsertText(string new_text, int32 position) cil managed

Docs.param: A pointer to the position within the Editable object for inserting the string.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsEditable { get; set; }
.property instance bool IsEditable

Docs.summary: Whether or not the user can edit the text in the editable widget or not.
Docs.value: A boolean; TRUE if the user can edit the text.

MemberSignature.Value: public void PasteClipboard ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PasteClipboard() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes the contents of the clipboard to be pasted into the given widget at the current cursor position.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Position { get; set; }
.property instance int32 Position

Docs.value: An integer position for the cursor.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SelectRegion (int start_pos, int end_pos);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SelectRegion(int32 start_pos, int32 end_pos) cil managed

Docs.remarks: The characters that are selected are those characters at positions from up to, but not including . If is negative, then the the characters selected will be those characters from to the end of the text.

MemberSignature.Value: public event Gtk.TextDeletedHandler TextDeleted;
.event class Gtk.TextDeletedHandler TextDeleted

Docs.summary: Raised whenever the user deletes text.
Docs.remarks: The default handler for this signal will normally be responsible for inserting the text, so by connecting to this signal and then stopping the signal with gtk_signal_emit_stop(), it is possible to modify the inserted text, or prevent it from being inserted entirely. The and parameters are interpreted as for (FIXME: need equivalent for gtk_signal_emit_stop().)

MemberSignature.Value: public event Gtk.TextInsertedHandler TextInserted;
.event class Gtk.TextInsertedHandler TextInserted

Docs.summary: Raised whenever the user inserts text.
Docs.remarks: The default handler for this signal will normally be responsible for inserting the text, so by connecting to this signal and then stopping the signal with gtk_signal_emit_stop(), it is possible to modify the inserted text, or prevent it from being inserted entirely. (FIXME: Need Gtk# equivalent for gtk_signal_emit_stop().)
